intro: Dikylikostigma, commonly known as the climbing nightshade, is a member of the Solanaceae family. It is a perennial vine that produces small, bell-shaped flowers and red berries. The plant is native to regions of Central and South America. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Dikylikostigma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
